sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the predicted products of the reaction between copper sulfate and zinc metal?
message_2:
The reaction between copper sulfate (CuSO₄) and zinc metal (Zn) is a single displacement reaction. In this reaction, zinc displaces copper from copper sulfate, forming zinc sulfate (ZnSO₄) and copper metal (Cu). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CuSO₄(aq) + Zn(s) → ZnSO₄(aq) + Cu(s)

The predicted products are zinc sulfate (ZnSO₄) and copper metal (Cu).
